morphus API Specification

Overview •  Architecture •  API Higlights

morphus is a toolkit designed for 3D stereo displays.

See: Description

API 
Package Description
org.morphus  
org.morphus.renderer
Renderer classes.
org.morphus.stereo
3D stereoscopic display classes.
Overview •  Architecture •  API Higlights

morphus is a toolkit designed for 3D stereo displays.

morphus is a toolkit designed for 3D stereo displays that contains of utility classes and APIs to create 3D stereoscopic applications using Openg GL ES 2.0 or higher.

This toolkit provides a set of base building-block classes that you can build on top to create your own OpenGL ES based 3D stereoscopic applications. Purpose is to provide simple base classes for developers to extends from. Alternatively you can write your apps from scratch if you like, without any need to use any or all parts of this SDK.

Architecture

API Higlights

Usage:

  1. Create a org.morphus.MoConfig using the org.morphus.MoConfig.Builder class and setting it up with your specific OpenGL environment.
  2. Create the main org.morphus.MoSDK using the above configuration object and setting it up with your specific OpenGL environment. This class contains the factory method to create Display object that you will need to setup the 3D stereo display.
  3. Create your surface view whether using Android's default GLSurfaceView or your own custom implementation.
  4. Create your renderer class which can extend from AbstractRenderer for your convenience. NOTE: If you decide to use your own renderer implementation then you will have to handle the two-camera viewports for stereo mode yourself, which can be done by using the camera from the org.morphus.MoSDK's org.morphus.MoSDK#createCamera(org.morphus.stereo.Camera.Channel) method.
  5. Implement the necessary abstract methods in your renderer and put the actual scene renderering code in the org.morphus.renderer.AbstractRenderer#drawFrame(float[]) method.

Requirements:

NOTE: Minimum supported version of OpenGL ES is 2.0 or above.

Following entires are required in AndroidManifest.xml: 

    <uses-feature android:glEsVersion="0x00020000" android:required="true" />

    <uses-library android:name="com.ti.s3d" android:required="false" />

3rd Party Libraries:

  • Use Aniqroid Version 3.0+ for any image caching or texture caching.
